page.title: 03Working in Norton
page.content: A questionnaire on the employment of Norton people showed that close to half of the people who answered the questions were not employed, although this included both men and women.Of those people in employment the pottery industry employed most,just over 15%. Coal mining,once the dominant industry now only employs 2% of the workers, agriculture has also declined, with only 0.5% of our sample. A number of people (7%) work in shops, either locally or in the nearby Pottery towns whilst a further 10% work in offices, and 6% in engineering. But the most obvious result of our survey was the variety of jobs,there being well over 30 different jobs identified, this is probably a result of the closeness of a large city and the ease of communications.
